definition: fire and ice/combination of sharply contrasting or incompatible elements
ice/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/to chill sth/(of an object or substance) to feel cold/(of a person) cold/unfriendly/(slang) methamphetamine
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: This is Iceland, a land of fire and ice.

sentences.english: This world of difference continues almost a year in Shenyang labour market of migrant workers.

sentences.english: Fire and ice also meet to create beautiful scenes in another part of Iceland.

sentences.english: A key feature of the world economy today is that it is running at two speeds.
sentences.chinese: 當今世界經濟的一大特徵是冰火兩重天。
